00026 ///A generic 2-element tuple that is represented by Single-precision floating point x,y coordinates. 
00027 typedef public ref struct Tuple2f_t
00028 {
00029         GLfloat X, Y;
00030 
00031         Tuple2f_t^ operator+(Tuple2f_t^ a) 
00032         { //outside the class
00033                 Tuple2f_t^ result=gcnew Tuple2f_t();
00034                 result->X=a->X+X;
00035                 result->Y=a->Y+Y;
00036                 return result;
00037         };
00038 
00039 
00040 } Tuple2fT;

00042 ///A generic 3-element tuple that is represented by Single precision-floating point x,y,z coordinates. 
00043 typedef public ref struct Tuple3f_t
00044 {
00045         GLfloat X, Y, Z;
00046 } Tuple3fT;

00054 ///A Single precision floating point 3 by 3 matrix. 
00055 typedef public ref struct Matrix3f_t
00056 {
00057         //column major
00058         GLfloat XX; GLfloat XY;  GLfloat XZ;
00059         GLfloat YX; GLfloat YY;  GLfloat YZ;
00060         GLfloat ZX; GLfloat ZY;  GLfloat ZZ;
00061 } Matrix3fT;     
00062 
00063 ///A Single precision floating point 4 by 4 matrix.
00064 typedef public ref struct Matrix4f_t
00065 {
00066         //column major
00067         GLfloat XX;  GLfloat XY;  GLfloat XZ;   GLfloat XW; 
00068         GLfloat YX;  GLfloat YY;  GLfloat YZ;   GLfloat YW; 
00069         GLfloat ZX;  GLfloat ZY;  GLfloat ZZ;   GLfloat ZW; 
00070         GLfloat TX;  GLfloat TY;  GLfloat TZ;   GLfloat TW; 
00071 } Matrix4fT;

00076 #define Quat4fT     Tuple4fT   ///A 4 element unit quaternion represented by Single precision floating point x,y,z,w coordinates. 
00077 #define Vector2fT   Tuple2fT   ///A 2-element vector that is represented by Single-precision floating point x,y coordinates.

00085 /**
00086 * Sets the value of this tuple to the vector sum of itself and tuple t1.
00087 * @param NewObj This tuple point.
00088 * @param t1  the other tuple
00089 */
00090 inline static void Point2fAdd(Point2fT^ NewObj,  Tuple2fT^ t1)
00091 {
00092         assert(NewObj && t1);
00093 
00094         NewObj->X += t1->X;
00095         NewObj->Y += t1->Y;
00096 }
00097 
00098 /**
00099 * Sets the value of this tuple to the vector difference of itself and tuple t1 (this = this - t1).
00100 * @param NewObj This tuple point.
00101 * @param t1 The other tuple.
00102 */
00103 inline static void Point2fSub(Point2fT^ NewObj,  Tuple2fT^ t1)
00104 {
00105         assert(NewObj && t1);
00106 
00107         NewObj->X -= t1->X;
00108         NewObj->Y -= t1->Y;
00109 }
00110 
00111 /**
00112 * Sets this vector to be the vector cross product of vectors v1 and v2.
00113 * @param Result The Resulted vector.
00114 * @param v1 the first vector.
00115 * @param v2 the second vector.
00116 */
00117 inline static void Vector3fCross(Vector3fT^ Result, Vector3fT^ v1, Vector3fT^ v2)
00118 {
00119         //Vector3fT Result; //safe not to initialize
00120 
00121         assert(Result && v1 && v2);
00122 
00123         /// store on stack once for aliasing-safty
00124         /// i.e. safe when a.cross(a, b)
00125 
00126         Result->X = (v1->Y * v2->Z) - (v1->Z * v2->Y);
00127         Result->Y = (v1->Z * v2->X) - (v1->X * v2->Z);
00128         Result->Z = (v1->X * v2->Y) - (v1->Y * v2->X);
00129 
00130         //copy result back
00131         //*NewObj = Result;
00132 }
00133 
00134 /**
00135 * Computes the dot product of the this vector and vector v1.
00136 * @param NewObj This vector.
00137 * @param  v1 the other vector.
00138 */
00139 inline  static GLfloat Vector3fDot(const Vector3fT^ NewObj, const Vector3fT^ v1)
00140 {
00141         assert(NewObj && v1);
00142 
00143         return  (NewObj->X * v1->X) +
00144                 (NewObj->Y * v1->Y) +
00145                 (NewObj->Z * v1->Z);
00146 }
00147 
00148 /**
00149 * Returns the squared length of this vector.
00150 * @param NewObj This vector.
00151 * @return the squared length of this vector.
00152 */
00153 inline static GLfloat Vector3fLengthSquared( Vector3fT^ NewObj)
00154 {
00155         assert(NewObj);
00156 
00157         return  (NewObj->X * NewObj->X) +
00158                 (NewObj->Y * NewObj->Y) +
00159                 (NewObj->Z * NewObj->Z);
00160 }
00161 
00162 /**
00163 * Returns the length of this vector.
00164 * @param NewObj This vector.
00165 * @return the length of this vector
00166 */
00167 inline static GLfloat Vector3fLength(Vector3fT^ NewObj)
00168 {
00169         assert(NewObj);
00170 
00171         return Funcsqrt(Vector3fLengthSquared(NewObj));
00172 }

00174 /**
00175 * Sets this Matrix3 to zero.
00176 * @param NewObj This matrix.
00177 */
00178 inline static void Matrix3fSetZero(Matrix3fT^ NewObj)
00179 {
00180         NewObj->XX = NewObj->XY = NewObj->XZ = 0.0f;
00181         NewObj->YX = NewObj->YY = NewObj->YZ = 0.0f;
00182         NewObj->ZX = NewObj->ZY = NewObj->ZZ = 0.0f;
00183 }
00184 
00185 /**
00186 * Sets this Matrix3 to identity.
00187 * @param NewObj This matrix.
00188 */
00189 inline static void Matrix3fSetIdentity(Matrix3fT^ NewObj)
00190 {
00191         Matrix3fSetZero(NewObj);
00192 
00193         ///then set diagonal as 1
00194         NewObj->XX = NewObj->YY = NewObj->ZZ = 1.0f;
00195 }

00197 /**
00198 * Sets the value of this matrix to the matrix conversion of the
00199 * quaternion argument. 
00200 * @param NewObj This matrix.
00201 * @param q1 the quaternion to be converted 
00202 */
00203 //$hack this can be optimized some(if s == 0)
00204 inline static void Matrix3fSetRotationFromQuat4f(Matrix3fT^% NewObj, Quat4fT^ q1)
00205 {
00206         GLfloat n, s;
00207         GLfloat xs, ys, zs;
00208         GLfloat wx, wy, wz;
00209         GLfloat xx, xy, xz;
00210         GLfloat yy, yz, zz;
00211 
00212         assert(NewObj && q1);
00213 
00214         Matrix3fT^ tNewObj=gcnew Matrix3fT();
00215 
00216 
00217         n = (q1->X * q1->X) + (q1->Y * q1->Y) + (q1->Z * q1->Z) + (q1->W * q1->W);
00218         s = (n > 0.0f) ? (2.0f / n) : 0.0f;
00219 
00220         xs = q1->X * s;  ys = q1->Y * s;  zs = q1->Z * s;
00221         wx = q1->W * xs; wy = q1->W * ys; wz = q1->W * zs;
00222         xx = q1->X * xs; xy = q1->X * ys; xz = q1->X * zs;
00223         yy = q1->Y * ys; yz = q1->Y * zs; zz = q1->Z * zs;
00224 
00225         tNewObj->XX = 1.0f - (yy + zz); tNewObj->YX =         xy - wz;  tNewObj->ZX =         xz + wy;
00226         tNewObj->XY =         xy + wz;  tNewObj->YY = 1.0f - (xx + zz); tNewObj->ZY =         yz - wx;
00227         tNewObj->XZ =         xz - wy;  tNewObj->YZ =         yz + wx;  tNewObj->ZZ = 1.0f - (xx + yy);
00228 
00229         NewObj=tNewObj;
00230 }
00231 
00232 /**
00233 * Sets the value of this matrix to the result of multiplying itself
00234 * with matrix m1. 
00235 * @param NewObj This matrix.
00236 * @param m1 the other matrix 
00237 */
00238 inline static void Matrix3fMulMatrix3f(Matrix3fT^% NewObj, Matrix3fT^ m1)
00239 {
00240         Matrix3fT^ Result=gcnew Matrix3fT(); //safe not to initialize
00241 
00242         assert(NewObj && m1);
00243 
00244         // alias-safe way.
00245         Result->XX = (NewObj->XX * m1->XX) + (NewObj->YX * m1->XY) + (NewObj->ZX * m1->XZ);
00246         Result->YX = (NewObj->XX * m1->YX) + (NewObj->YX * m1->YY) + (NewObj->ZX * m1->YZ);
00247         Result->ZX = (NewObj->XX * m1->ZX) + (NewObj->YX * m1->ZY) + (NewObj->ZX * m1->ZZ);
00248 
00249         Result->XY = (NewObj->XY * m1->XX) + (NewObj->YY * m1->XY) + (NewObj->ZY * m1->XZ);
00250         Result->YY = (NewObj->XY * m1->YX) + (NewObj->YY * m1->YY) + (NewObj->ZY * m1->YZ);
00251         Result->ZY = (NewObj->XY * m1->ZX) + (NewObj->YY * m1->ZY) + (NewObj->ZY * m1->ZZ);
00252 
00253         Result->XZ = (NewObj->XZ * m1->XX) + (NewObj->YZ * m1->XY) + (NewObj->ZZ * m1->XZ);
00254         Result->YZ = (NewObj->XZ * m1->YX) + (NewObj->YZ * m1->YY) + (NewObj->ZZ * m1->YZ);
00255         Result->ZZ = (NewObj->XZ * m1->ZX) + (NewObj->YZ * m1->ZY) + (NewObj->ZZ * m1->ZZ);
00256 
00257         //copy result back to this
00258         NewObj = Result;
00259 }

00261 /**
00262 * Sets the value of this matrix to the matrix m1.
00263 * @param NewObj This matrix.
00264 * @param m1 the other matrix 
00265 */
00266 inline static void Matrix4fSetRotationScaleFromMatrix4f(Matrix4fT^ NewObj, Matrix4fT^ m1)
00267 {
00268         assert(NewObj && m1);
00269 
00270         NewObj->XX = m1->XX; NewObj->YX = m1->YX; NewObj->ZX = m1->ZX;
00271         NewObj->XY = m1->XY; NewObj->YY = m1->YY; NewObj->ZY = m1->ZY;
00272         NewObj->XZ = m1->XZ; NewObj->YZ = m1->YZ; NewObj->ZZ = m1->ZZ;
00273 }
00274 
00275 /**
00276 * Performs SVD on this matrix and gets scale and rotation.
00277 * Rotation is placed into rot3, and rot4.
00278 * @param NewObj This matrix.
00279 * @param rot3 the rotation factor(Matrix3d). if null, ignored
00280 * @param rot4 the rotation factor(Matrix4) only upper 3x3 elements are changed. if null, ignored
00281 * @return scale factor
00282 */
00283 inline static GLfloat Matrix4fSVD(Matrix4fT^ NewObj, Matrix3fT^ rot3, Matrix4fT^ rot4)
00284 {
00285         GLfloat s, n;
00286 
00287         assert(NewObj);
00288 
00289         /// this is a simple svd.
00290         /// Not complete but fast and reasonable.
00291         /// See comment in Matrix3d.
00292 
00293         s = Funcsqrt(
00294                 ( (NewObj->XX * NewObj->XX) + (NewObj->XY * NewObj->XY) + (NewObj->XZ * NewObj->XZ) + 
00295                 (NewObj->YX * NewObj->YX) + (NewObj->YY * NewObj->YY) + (NewObj->YZ * NewObj->YZ) +
00296                 (NewObj->ZX * NewObj->ZX) + (NewObj->ZY * NewObj->ZY) + (NewObj->ZZ * NewObj->ZZ) ) / 3.0f );
00297 
00298         if (rot3)   //if pointer not null
00299         {
00300                 //this->getRotationScale(rot3);
00301                 rot3->XX = NewObj->XX; rot3->XY = NewObj->XY; rot3->XZ = NewObj->XZ;
00302                 rot3->YX = NewObj->YX; rot3->YY = NewObj->YY; rot3->YZ = NewObj->YZ;
00303                 rot3->ZX = NewObj->ZX; rot3->ZY = NewObj->ZY; rot3->ZZ = NewObj->ZZ;
00304 
00305                 // zero-div may occur.
00306 
00307                 n = 1.0f / Funcsqrt( (NewObj->XX * NewObj->XX) +
00308                         (NewObj->XY * NewObj->XY) +
00309                         (NewObj->XZ * NewObj->XZ) );
00310                 rot3->XX *= n;
00311                 rot3->XY *= n;
00312                 rot3->XZ *= n;
00313 
00314                 n = 1.0f / Funcsqrt( (NewObj->YX * NewObj->YX) +
00315                         (NewObj->YY * NewObj->YY) +
00316                         (NewObj->YZ * NewObj->YZ) );
00317                 rot3->YX *= n;
00318                 rot3->YY *= n;
00319                 rot3->YZ *= n;
00320 
00321                 n = 1.0f / Funcsqrt( (NewObj->ZX * NewObj->ZX) +
00322                         (NewObj->ZY * NewObj->ZY) +
00323                         (NewObj->ZZ * NewObj->ZZ) );
00324                 rot3->ZX *= n;
00325                 rot3->ZY *= n;
00326                 rot3->ZZ *= n;
00327         }
00328 
00329         if (rot4)   //if pointer not null
00330         {
00331                 if (rot4 != NewObj)
00332                 {
00333                         Matrix4fSetRotationScaleFromMatrix4f(rot4, NewObj);  // private method
00334                 }
00335 
00336                 // zero-div may occur.
00337 
00338                 n = 1.0f / Funcsqrt( (NewObj->XX * NewObj->XX) +
00339                         (NewObj->XY * NewObj->XY) +
00340                         (NewObj->XZ * NewObj->XZ) );
00341                 rot4->XX *= n;
00342                 rot4->XY *= n;
00343                 rot4->XZ *= n;
00344 
00345                 n = 1.0f / Funcsqrt( (NewObj->YX * NewObj->YX) +
00346                         (NewObj->YY * NewObj->YY) +
00347                         (NewObj->YZ * NewObj->YZ) );
00348                 rot4->YX *= n;
00349                 rot4->YY *= n;
00350                 rot4->YZ *= n;
00351 
00352                 n = 1.0f / Funcsqrt( (NewObj->ZX * NewObj->ZX) +
00353                         (NewObj->ZY * NewObj->ZY) +
00354                         (NewObj->ZZ * NewObj->ZZ) );
00355                 rot4->ZX *= n;
00356                 rot4->ZY *= n;
00357                 rot4->ZZ *= n;
00358         }
00359 
00360         return s;
00361 }

00363 /**
00364 * Sets the value of this matrix to the matrix m1. 
00365 * @param NewObj This matrix.
00366 * @param m1 the other matrix 
00367 */
00368 inline static void Matrix4fSetRotationScaleFromMatrix3f(Matrix4fT^ NewObj, Matrix3fT^ m1)
00369 {
00370         assert(NewObj && m1);
00371 
00372         NewObj->XX = m1->XX; NewObj->YX = m1->YX; NewObj->ZX = m1->ZX;
00373         NewObj->XY = m1->XY; NewObj->YY = m1->YY; NewObj->ZY = m1->ZY;
00374         NewObj->XZ = m1->XZ; NewObj->YZ = m1->YZ; NewObj->ZZ = m1->ZZ;
00375 }

00377 /**
00378 * Sets the value of this matrix to the result of multiplying itself
00379 * with value scale. 
00380 * @param NewObj This matrix.
00381 * @param scale the value to scale matrix to 
00382 */
00383 inline static void Matrix4fMulRotationScale(Matrix4fT^ NewObj, GLfloat scale)
00384 {
00385         assert(NewObj);
00386 
00387         NewObj->XX *= scale; NewObj->YX *= scale; NewObj->ZX *= scale;
00388         NewObj->XY *= scale; NewObj->YY *= scale; NewObj->ZY *= scale;
00389         NewObj->XZ *= scale; NewObj->YZ *= scale; NewObj->ZZ *= scale;
00390 }
00391 
00392 /**
00393 * Sets the rotational component (upper 3x3) of this matrix to the matrix
00394 * values in the T precision Matrix3d argument; the other elements of
00395 * this matrix are unchanged; a singular value decomposition is performed
00396 * on this object's upper 3x3 matrix to factor out the scale, then this
00397 * object's upper 3x3 matrix components are replaced by the passed rotation
00398 * components, and then the scale is reapplied to the rotational
00399 * component
00400 * @param NewObj This matrix.
00401 * @param m1 T precision 3x3 matrix
00402 */
00403 inline static void Matrix4fSetRotationFromMatrix3f(Matrix4fT^ NewObj,  Matrix3fT^ m1)
00404 {
00405         GLfloat scale;
00406 
00407         assert(NewObj && m1);
00408 
00409         scale = Matrix4fSVD(NewObj, nullptr, nullptr);
00410 
00411         Matrix4fSetRotationScaleFromMatrix3f(NewObj, m1);
00412         Matrix4fMulRotationScale(NewObj, scale); 
00413 }

00415 /** \class ArcBall
00416 * Main Arcball class for the Shoemake algorithm 
00417 */
00418 typedef public ref class ArcBall_t
00419 {
00420 protected:
00421         inline
00422                 void _mapToSphere(Point2fT^ NewPt, Vector3fT^ NewVec) ;
00423 
00424 public:
00425         ///Create/Destroy
00426         ArcBall_t(GLfloat NewWidth, GLfloat NewHeight);
00427         ~ArcBall_t() { /* nothing to do */ };
00428 
00429         ///Set new bounds
00430         inline  void    setBounds(GLfloat NewWidth, GLfloat NewHeight)
00431         {
00432                 //assert((NewWidth > 1.0f) && (NewHeight > 1.0f));
00433 
00434                 //Set adjustment factor for width/height
00435                 this->AdjustWidth  = 1.0f / ((NewWidth  - 1.0f) * 0.5f);
00436                 this->AdjustHeight = 1.0f / ((NewHeight - 1.0f) * 0.5f);
00437         }
00438 
00439         ///Mouse down
00440         void    click(Point2fT^ NewPt);
00441 
00442         ///Mouse drag, calculate rotation
00443         void    drag(Point2fT^ NewPt, Quat4fT^ NewRot);
00444 
00445 protected:
00446         Vector3fT^   StVec;          ///Saved click vector
00447         Vector3fT^   EnVec;          ///Saved drag vector
00448         GLfloat     AdjustWidth;    ///Mouse bounds width
00449         GLfloat     AdjustHeight;   ///Mouse bounds height
00450 
00451 } ArcBallT;
